did.abstract: Chairman of the board of the Oakland County Community Mental Health Services Board and Oakland County Judge of Probate. The collection includes files accumulated from his work as member and chairman of the board of the Oakland County Community Mental Health Services Board established in the 1960s to implement the new state mental health code whose intent was to involve local communities in mental health care services; and personal correspondence with his wife Elizabeth Sparks Adams, diaries, family materials, and other papers relating to his career as a judge; also photographs.

bioghist.p: Donald E. Adams was born in Waterford, Michigan and attended Waterford and Pontiac public schools. He received his Bachelor of Arts degree from the University of Michigan in 1934 and his Juris Doctor degree in 1936. Adams began his career in public service in 1937 as a Justice of the Peace in Waterford Township. In 1961 he was elected to serve as Probate Judge in Oakland County and held that post until his retirement in 1977. Throughout his career, Adams also served on the boards of various public service organizations, including the Oakland County Community Mental Health Services Board.

scopecontent.p: This collection documents various aspects of Donald Adams' personal and professional life. His career as a judge and correspondence with his wife and family receive particular attention. The collection is divided into four series: Oakland County Community Mental Health Services Board, Personal, Professional, and Compiled Information.

did.unittitle: Oakland County Community Mental Health Services Board

scopecontent.p: The Oakland County Community Mental Health Services Board series (4 linear feet) is comprised of files accumulated from Adams' work as member and chairman of the board of the Oakland County Community Mental Health Services Board. The Board was established in the 1960s to implement the new state mental health code whose intent was to involve local communities in mental health care services.

The Personal series (0.9 linear feet) includes correspondence with Elizabeth Sparks Adams, and other family and friends. Some correspondence dates to the period prior to Adams' marriage to Elizabeth and to Adams' service in the Navy. Also included are a set of Adams' diaries dating from 1930 to 1936.
The Professional series (0.1 linear feet) contains material related to Adams' brief employment with the Michigan State Highway Department.

The Compiled Information series (1 linear foot) consists of bound volumes containing clippings, correspondence, and photographs documenting Adams' accomplishments as a judge and commemorating his retirement. Also included is an album with materials related to Michigan and Adams family history.
